channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipped furniture, 21st September
item.description:
The car park attached to the council flats at 1020-22 High Road (entrance on Derwent Crescent) is a regular fly tipping hotspot. Currently a bed base is blocking access to the cycle storage .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Derwent Crescent, Whetstone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of rubbish dumped by the Green Cabinet on Halt Robin Road Belvedere DA17 near the junction with Picardy Road Belvedere DA17, 21st September
item.description:
Several bags of rubbish have been dumped by the Green (Virgin Media) Cabinet on Halt Robin Road Belvedere DA17, approximately 10 metres from the junction with Picardy Road Belvedere DA17. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halt Robin Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of rubbish dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 Bus Stop, 21st September
item.description:
Several bags of rubbish have been dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 Bus Stop, approximately 25 metres from the junction with Halt Robin Road Belvedere DA17. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Confusing traffic signals, 21st September
item.description:
Travelling West on Sidcup road, at the junction with Court Road the indicated traffic light turns green while all other lights remained red. This implies that it is safe to drive forward, however lights are simultaneously green for cross traffic from Court Road as well as the pedestrian crossing over Sidcup road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red & black honda motorcycle damaged outside number 46 beatty road. broken & abandoned for one year now., 21st September
item.description:
This motorcycle has been abandoned for over one year now. It is abandoned & damaged/broken. Causing a major problem with taking up one parking space & causing a real nuisance for parking behind it also due to the way it is parked up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Beatty Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree is too big, 21st September
item.description:
The tree is far too big for the street and needs pruning. As far as I can remember it has only been pruned once in about 20 years. It blocks the light and the acorns cover the path causing unstable pavement and blocks the drains. It needs cutting. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prestbury Square, Elmstead, London
